NLP lab, Stony Brook University

Graduate Student Researcher • Jan, 2018 — Present

  • Clinical Trials are hard to find. Searches show a lot of trials which might be irrelevant to the user. The aim of this project is to use Natural Language Processing (NLP) to extract information from the existing trials and ask questions to the user in order to reduce the search space and only return the most relevant trials.
  • Stats: Was able to reduce the number of searches of Diabetes related clinical trials in long island from ~80 to ~10
  • Technologies: Python, pandas, numpy, tensorflow, matplotlib
